docs.snippet: Don Zimmer, who died Wednesday at 83, seemed to do it all in a baseball career of 60-plus years....
docs.lead_paragraph: Don Zimmer, who died Wednesday at 83, seemed to do it all in a baseball career of 60-plus years.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner An Appraisal column examines life and career of former New York Yankees bench coach Don Zimmer; says that wherever he went and whatever he did, Zimmer led a baseball life, and the sport has lost a little bit of its soul with news of his death.

docs.lead_paragraph: It has been nearly 33 years since a major league team representing New York played one from Los Angeles for a championship. That drought ends with the Stanley Cup finals.
docs.abstract: New York Rangers are facing Los Angeles Kings in Stanley Cup finals, ending a nearly 33-year drought since major league teams representing the two largest cities in the United States vied for a championship.

headline.main: New York vs. Los Angeles: Rivalry Revived
